page.title: 03The Drayton Chronicle
page.content: The Drayton Amenities Society produces a monthly local newspaper, the Drayton Chronicle. It is not an ordinary village newsheet but a twelve page professional style publication printed in Oxford. The Chronicle, is produced and distributed by a voluntary team of about sixty villagers. 875 copies are now distributed each month. It began in 1978 and costs about Â£1500 a year to produce. The costs are met mainly from a local lottery, tickets being sold by the Chronicle distributors. Each month about 1500 10p tickets are sold and Â£50 is given out in cash prizes. The remaining costs of production are met from local business advertising. The Chronicle includes coverage of local events, notes on clubs and societies, parish information, a countryman's diary and a letters page.
